intro: Scalesia baurii, commonly known as the Baur's tree heather, is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal areas, characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, which bloom in clusters. Scalesia baurii is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of the Galápagos, including high salinity and strong coastal winds. Its ecological significance is notable in the local flora, contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
